REDACTION OF ETHICS REPORTS FILED BY JUDICIAL OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES. Section 105(b) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 is amended to allow for redaction of reports filed by certain individuals if revealing personal information could endanger them. The redaction is only permitted to the extent necessary to protect the individual and as long as the danger exists. The Judicial Conference, in consultation with the United States Marshall Service, can redact reports to protect individuals from danger. The Administrative Office of the United States Courts must submit an annual report on the redacted reports. The Administrative Office of the United States Courts must submit an annual report on redacted reports, including the total number of reports and individuals affected, as well as the types of threats involved. The Judicial Conference, in consultation with the Department of Justice, will issue regulations on redaction circumstances and procedures. This provision expires on December 31, 2001, and applies to filings through calendar year 2001.
